text: The 2017 Portland State Vikings football team represented Portland State University during the 2017 NCAA Division I FCS football season. They were led by third-year head coach Bruce Barnum and played their home games at Providence Park, with one home game at Hillsboro Stadium. They were a member of the Big Sky Conference. They finished the season 0–11, 0–8 in Big Sky play to finish in last place. ==Schedule== Despite also being a member of the Big Sky Conference, the game with UC Davis on September 16 is considered a non- conference game. ==Game summaries== ===at BYU=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | colspan=3| First meeting |} ===at Oregon State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 0–4 | 2014 | ORST, 29–14 |} ===UC Davis=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 11–4 | 2016 | PSU, 51–29 |} ===Montana=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 12–29 | 2015 | PSU, 35–16 |} ===at Montana State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 10–19 | 2015 | PSU, 59–42 |} ===Northern Arizona=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 5–16 | 2014 | NAU, 21–17 |} ===at Idaho State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 17–24–1 | 2016 | PSU, 45–20 |} ===North Dakota=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 2–4 | 2015 | UND, 19–17 |} ===at Cal Poly=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 11–12 | 2016 | POLY, 53–33 |} ===Weber State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 14–21 | 2016 | WEB, 14–10 |} ===at Eastern Washington–The Dam Cup=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 20–18–1 | 2016 | EWU, 35–28 |} ==References== Portland State Category:Portland State Vikings football seasons Category:College football winless seasons Portland State Vikings football Portland State Vikings football
